definition: disciple/apprentice/believer/on foot/bare or empty/to no avail/only/prison sentence

sentences.english: In tenth-century France, the doors of traitors and criminals were painted yellow.
sentences.chinese: 在十世紀的法國，叛徒和罪犯的門都被漆成黃色。

sentences.english: He was labeled as a turncoat.
sentences.chinese: 有些工人開始認爲他是一個叛徒。

sentences.english: Many thought they were heroes while others called them lawless renegades.
sentences.chinese: 許多人認爲他們是英雄，而其他人叫他們不法叛徒。

sentences.english: I'll burn him, and show the north how I deal with turncloaks and traitors .
sentences.chinese: 我會燒了他，以示北境我是如何處理叛徒和變節者的。

sentences.english: Now I feel like a traitor, a saboteur to hundreds of years of progress.
sentences.chinese: 現在的我像是個叛徒，破壞了幾百年來取得的進步。

sentences.english: The traitor refused to confess and was racked at last.
sentences.chinese: 叛徒拒不招供，最後被拖到拉肢刑架上施刑。

sentences.english: Little imagine Zhang Wanchuan defection, already become a traitor.
sentences.chinese: 殊不知張萬川早已變節，成爲叛徒。

sentences.english: In other words, Kautsky is a renegade.
sentences.chinese: 換言之，考茨基是個叛徒。

sentences.english: Little imagine old gu but ever been traitor sold, exposed the identity.
sentences.chinese: 殊不知老顧卻曾經被叛徒出賣，暴露了身份。

sentences.english: Thirdly, his work is a betrayer.
My sisters -- epic traitors that they are -- changed their last name years ago.
sentences.chinese: 我的姐姐們全是大叛徒，幾年前都改了姓。

sentences.english: Indians were ruled by external forces by centuries bcoz of traitors within themselves;
sentences.chinese: 由於內部的叛徒，印度人被外部力量統治了數世紀。

sentences.english: And the traitors is been they trusted brothers Lin Wu Yang.
sentences.chinese: 而這個叛徒正是一直被他們所信賴的兄弟林午陽。

sentences.english: I'm a renegade, a turncoat, a Scalawag.
sentences.chinese: 我是個叛徒，變節者，流氓。

sentences.english: He transferred to Germany, the traitor.
sentences.chinese: 他轉會去德國了，這個叛徒。

definition: remaining evil element/surviving members (of evil former regime)/dregs (of colonial administration)
undiscovered traitor/enemy within one's own ranks
to betray one's party/to defect (from the communist party)/renegade faction
to go over to the enemy/to defect
breaking faith and abandoning right (idiom); to betray/treachery/perfidy
